lesson.name: T5R2 Reading: Assessment and Student Goals

page.title: Aligning Assessment and Instruction with Goals
page.contents:
Read the brief webpage focused on aligning instruction and student goals.  The target audience for the piece is higher education and the perspective of the goals is from the teacher; however, the principles are sound for adult basic education as well.   Note that your discussion question for the reading is adapted from the “Ideas to consider” questions from the webpage. 

Aligning Goals with Your Course

http://assessment.georgetown.edu/courselevel/align-goals-with-curriculum/ 

Assessment. Georgetown.edu, Georgetown University, Washington DC

Questions for Discussion:

Think about the assessment activities you use in your instruction:

  • Are any activities specifically targeted to assess your students’ mastery of their learning goals?  Why or why not? 
  • Please provide one or more examples of assessment activities you use to assess mastery of student goals – or ones you wish to use (based on what you have learned in this course).

*Note that this website is rich in assessment information for the classroom and beyond.  You may wish to take time to explore its resources further.  http://assessment.georgetown.edu/
